items.title: Solano Public Health celebrates grand opening of milk collection center during National Breastfeeding Month
items.summary: The Solano County Department of Health and Social Services, Public Health division, in partnership with the San Jose Mother's Milk Bank and First 5 Solano, announce the opening of the first human milk collection center in Solano County. The grand opening will take place on Thursday, August 11, 2022, from 10:30 a.m. to 11 a.m. at 2101 Courage Drive, Fairfield. Families, prospective donors, healthcare providers and community members are welcome to attend the family-friendly grand opening.

items.title: Solano County Public Health confirms case of Monkeypox
items.summary: The Solano County Department of Health and Social Services, Public Health division, has confirmed the first case of monkeypox identified in Solano County. Solano Public Health has also identified two probable cases, both pending confirmation from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). As of today, there are a total of 250 probable and confirmed cases in California.

items.title: Solano County, Partnership HealthPlan of California and Community Partners launch Pediatric Vaccine Resource for Families
items.summary: Solano County Public Health, First 5 Solano, Partnership HealthPlan of California (PHC), Ole Health, La Clinica, Help Me Grow Solano and Child Start have developed and launched a new website for parents and families seeking information about childhood immunizations.

items.title: West Nile virus activity detected in Solano County
items.summary: The Solano County Department of Health and Social Services, Public Health division, and the Solano County Mosquito Abatement District (SCMAD) have confirmed that a bird has tested positive for West Nile virus (WNV). The specimen sample was collected in late June in Vacaville. As of July 11, 2022, the California Department of Public Health reports that there are no human cases of WNV.

items.title: Solano County’s eviction protections remains in effect after State protections end; no scheduled termination date at this time
items.summary: Solano County's Emergency Regulation establishing a temporary, countywide moratorium on evictions for non-payment of rent by residential or commercial tenants directly impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic is still in effect.
